citeinfo.title: Projected climatic conditions by 10 Global Climate Models for variables used to project wetland densities in the Prairie Pothole Region
Projected wetland densities under climate change: habitat loss but little geographic shift in conservation strategy

descript.abstract: Derived climatic variables based on the historical and future simulations of ten Global Climate Models.
descript.purpose: Data were used to project wetland densities in the Prairie Pothole Region under climate change.

idinfo.accconst: None. Please see 'Distribution Info' for details.
idinfo.useconst: None. Users are advised to read the data set's metadata thoroughly to understand appropriate use and data limitations.
idinfo.datacred: Funding for this work was provided by the North Central Climate Science Center (G13AC00390 and G12AC20504).
idinfo.native: Environment as of Metadata Creation: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.3.1 (Build 4959) Service Pack N/A (Build N/A)

attracc.attraccr: No formal attribute accuracy tests were conducted.

dataqual.logic: No formal logical accuracy tests were conducted.
dataqual.complete: Data set is considered complete for the information presented, as described in the abstract. Users are advised to read the rest of the metadata record carefully for additional details.

horizpa.horizpar: A formal accuracy assessment of the horizontal positional information in the data set has not been conducted.

vertacc.vertaccr: A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the data set has either not been conducted, or is not applicable.

citeinfo.origin: Maurer, E. P., L. Brekke, T. Pruitt, and P. B. Duffy
citeinfo.title: Climate projections

srcinfo.srccontr: Source information used in support of the development of the data set.

procstep.procdesc: Data were summarized in R to create each derived climate variable.

enttyp.enttypd: Table containing attribute information associated with the data set.

attrdomv.udom: Concatenation of Statrum, Transect, and Segment in USFWS Waterfowl Breeding Population and Habitat Survey (Traditional Strata only)
Name of each of the 10 climate models used to develop wetland projections under climate change
This column added by default by write.csv in R

attr.attrdef: Longitude in WGS84 corresponding to the center of the closest climate grid cell
Latitude in WGS84 corresponding to the center of the closest climate grid cell
Mean of monthly maximum temperatures in March, April, and May from GCM simulations (degrees C).
Max of monthly maximum temperatures in June, July, August, and Sept. from Maurer et al. 2002 historical climate data.
The difference between minimum and maximum temperatures in the first month of the calendar year in which mean temperature was above 0°C based on Maurer et al. 2002 historical climate data.
April surface runoff estimated from the hydrological VIC model (monthly sum in mm) based on GCM simulations
May surface runoff estimated from the hydrological VIC model (monthly sum in mm) based on GCM simulations
Total soil moisture during the previous October (1st of the month) estimated from the hydrological VIC model (monthly sum in mm) based on GCM simulations.
Total precipitation minus potential evapotranspiration from June in the previous year through May of the surveyed year. Potential evapotranspiration was estimated with the Penman-Monteith formula.

Total precipitation minus potential evapotranspiration from June-May over the previous 5 years (i.e., not including the past year). Potential evapotranspiration was estimated with the Penman-Monteith formula.

overview.eaover: The entity and attribute information provided here describes the tabular data associated with the data set. Please review the detailed descriptions that are provided (the individual attribute descriptions) for information on the values that appear as fields/table entries of the data set.
overview.eadetcit: The entity and attribute information was generated by the individual and/or agency identified as the originator of the data set. Please review the rest of the metadata record for additional details and information.
